Class ShoppingBag

  • java.lang.Object
    • ShoppingBag

  • public class ShoppingBag
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the shopping bag it holds the array of items and the methods that control the shopping bag each method manipulates the array of items depending on the users input Uses grocery item to control the array and the bag
    Author:
    Jonathan Cattuna, George Job

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private GroceryItem[] bag 
      private int size 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShoppingBag()
      Creates new ShoppingBag object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(GroceryItem item)
      adds one item into the shopping bag array and increases the current size of the bag and adds on the end and gets a new index
      void checkoutPrint()
      Prints out items when the user tries to check out
      void emptyShoppingBag()
      clears the array and empties the shopping bag
      private int find(GroceryItem item) 
      int getArrayLength()
      Get array length of the array used for the current shopping bag
      int getSize()
      gets the size of the array
      private void grow()
      Grows the bag size by 5 when it reachs capacity and holds a capacity variable that is changing per item added
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Test Bed Main.
      void print()
      prints all items in current cart, if empty displays "bag is empty"
      boolean remove(GroceryItem item)
      Removes one object from the array and replaces it with the item in the last index reorganize shopping bag array but order doesn't matter because of find method.
      double salesPrice()
      tracks sales price of full cart based on items inside
      double salesTax()
      tracks which items are taxable and which are not and adds tax based on their price

    • Method Detail

      • find

        private int find(GroceryItem item)
        Parameters:
        item - GroceryItem to search for in the ShoppingBag
        Returns:
        index of the GroceryItem in the ShoppingBag, returns -1 if not found

      • grow

        private void grow()
        Grows the bag size by 5 when it reachs capacity and holds a capacity variable that is changing per item added

      • add

        public void add(GroceryItem item)
        adds one item into the shopping bag array and increases the current size of the bag and adds on the end and gets a new index
        Parameters:
        item - GroceryItem to be added to the bag

      • remove

        public boolean remove(GroceryItem item)
        Removes one object from the array and replaces it with the item in the last index reorganize shopping bag array but order doesn't matter because of find method.
        Parameters:
        item - GroceryItem to be removed from bag
        Returns:
        true if removed, false if item not removed

      • salesPrice

        public double salesPrice()
        tracks sales price of full cart based on items inside
        Returns:
        total sales price

      • salesTax

        public double salesTax()
        tracks which items are taxable and which are not and adds tax based on their price
        Returns:
        total sales tax

      • print

        public void print()
        prints all items in current cart, if empty displays "bag is empty"

      • checkoutPrint

        public void checkoutPrint()
        Prints out items when the user tries to check out

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        gets the size of the array
        Returns:
        size of array

      • emptyShoppingBag

        public void emptyShoppingBag()
        clears the array and empties the shopping bag

      • getArrayLength

        public int getArrayLength()
        Get array length of the array used for the current shopping bag

        length of array for shopping bag
